00032 #elif defined(_WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__) || defined(WIN32) ||               \
00033     defined(MSC_VER)

00061     template <typename T>
00062     static inline void read_vector_from_file(std::vector<T> &v,
00063             std::string file)
00064     {
00065         v.clear();
00066         std::ifstream source(file);
00067         if (!source.good()) {
00068             std::cout << "Error: file " << file << " does not exist\n";
00069             source.close();
00070             exit(-1);
00071         }
00072 
00073         for (std::string line; std::getline(source, line);) {
00074             std::istringstream in(line);
00075             T type;
00076             while (in >> type)
00077                 v.push_back(type);
00078         }
00079 
00080         source.close();
00081     }
00082 
00083     template <typename T>
00084     static inline void dump_to_file(std::vector<T> &v, std::string file)
00085     {
00086 
00087         std::ofstream output_file(file);
00088 
00089         std::ostream_iterator<T> output_iterator(output_file, "\n");
00090         std::copy(v.begin(), v.end(), output_iterator);
00091 
00092         output_file.close();
00093     }

00123     static inline char const *GETENV(char const *envstr)
00124     {
00125         char const *env = getenv(envstr);
00126         if (!env)
00127             return "0";
00128         else
00129             return env;
00130     }

00141     {
00142         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {

00185     static inline double time_diff(timespec const &end, timespec const &begin)
00186     {
00187 #ifdef TIMING
00188         double result;
00189 
00190         result = end.tv_sec - begin.tv_sec;
00191         result += (end.tv_nsec - begin.tv_nsec) / (double)1000000000;
00192 
00193         return result;
00194 #else
00195         return 0;
00196 #endif
00197     }
00198 
00199     static inline void get_time(timespec &ts)
00200     {
00201 #ifdef TIMING
00202         auto time = std::chrono::system_clock::now();
00203         ts.tv_sec = std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::seconds>(
00204                         time.time_since_epoch())
00205                     .count();
00206         ts.tv_nsec = std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::microseconds>(
00207                          time.time_since_epoch())
00208                      .count();
00209 #endif
00210     }
00211 
00212     static inline timespec get_time()
00213     {
00214         timespec t;
00215 #ifdef TIMING
00216         get_time(t);
00217 #endif
00218         return t;
00219     }
00220 
00221     static inline double time_elapsed(timespec const &begin)
00222     {
00223 #ifdef TIMING
00224         timespec now;
00225         get_time(now);
00226         return time_diff(now, begin);
00227 #else
00228         return 0;
00229 #endif
00230     }

00233                                   timespec const &end)
00234     {
00235 #ifdef TIMING
00236         dprintf("%s : %.3f\n", prompt, time_diff(end, begin));

00248                                           timespec const &begin)
00249     {

00255     static inline std::string exec(const char *cmd)
00256     {
00257 #ifdef WIN32
00258         std::shared_ptr<FILE> pipe(_popen(cmd, "r"), _pclose);
00259 #else
00260         std::shared_ptr<FILE> pipe(popen(cmd, "r"), pclose);
00261 #endif
00262         if (!pipe)
00263             return "ERROR";
00264         char buffer[128];
00265         std::string result = "";
00266         while (!feof(pipe.get())) {
00267             if (fgets(buffer, 128, pipe.get()) != NULL)
00268                 result += buffer;
00269         }
00270         return result;
00271     }

00273     static inline std::string read_from_file(std::string filename)
00274     {
00275         std::ifstream t(filename);
00276         std::stringstream res;
00277         res << t.rdbuf();
00278         return res.str();
00279     }

00281     struct API Arg : public option::Arg {
00282         static void printError(const char *msg1, const option::Option &opt,
00283                                const char *msg2)
00284         {
00285             fprintf(stderr, "%s", msg1);
00286             fwrite(opt.name, opt.namelen, 1, stderr);
00287             fprintf(stderr, "%s", msg2);
00288         }
00289 
00290         static option::ArgStatus Unknown(const option::Option &option,
00291                                          bool msg)
00292         {
00293             if (msg)
00294                 printError("Unknown option '", option, "'\n");
00295             return option::ARG_ILLEGAL;
00296         }
00297 
00298         static option::ArgStatus Required(const option::Option &option,
00299                                           bool msg)
00300         {
00301             if (option.arg != 0)
00302                 return option::ARG_OK;
00303 
00304             if (msg)
00305                 printError("Option '", option, "' requires an argument\n");
00306             return option::ARG_ILLEGAL;
00307         }
00308 
00309         static option::ArgStatus NonEmpty(const option::Option &option,
00310                                           bool msg)
00311         {
00312             if (option.arg != 0 && option.arg[0] != 0)
00313                 return option::ARG_OK;
00314 
00315             if (msg)
00316                 printError("Option '", option,
00317                            "' requires a non-empty argument\n");
00318             return option::ARG_ILLEGAL;
00319         }
00320 
00321         static option::ArgStatus Numeric(const option::Option &option,
00322                                          bool msg)
00323         {
00324             // printf("Inside here\n");
00325             char *endptr = 0;
00326             if (option.arg != 0 && strtol(option.arg, &endptr, 10)) {
00327             };
00328             if (endptr != option.arg && *endptr == 0)
00329                 return option::ARG_OK;
00330 
00331             if (msg)
00332                 printError("Option '", option,
00333                            "' requires a numeric argument\n");
00334             return option::ARG_ILLEGAL;
00335         }
00336     };
